3/22/2007 
 
dmca@ev1.net 
 
RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED 
 
  
 
Designated Agent 
 
Everyones Internet 
 
Chris Newcomb 
 
390 Benmar Ste 200 
 
Houston TX 77060 
 
  
 
Re:       Unauthorized Use of Intellectual Property  
 
Dear Designated Agent: 
 
This letter is to provide you notice pursuant to 17 U.S.C. § 512 (c)(3)(A) of
unauthorized use of copyrighted material owned or licensed by iN DEMAND L.L.C. ("iN
DEMAND Networks") by your client, mininova.com, at the URL http://www.mininova.com/.
 The Howard Stern Production Company ("Stern") is the owner of all Howard Stern
shows and unaired footage from shows aired on both the E! channel and the iN DEMAND
video-on-demand service, and iN DEMAND L.L.C. is the exclusive licensee of Howard
Stern shows and the owner of all original productions related to the Howard Stern
shows (such copyrighted material is referred to as "iN DEMAND Networks Works").  iN
DEMAND Networks has a good faith belief that use by your client is not authorized by
either iN DEMAND Networks or Stern, their agents, or the law.  The information
contained in this letter is accurate, and under the penalty of perjury, Net
Enforcers is authorized to act on behalf of iN DEMAND Networks. 
 
  
 
The specific works, graphics, or other material iN DEMAND Networks believes to be
infringed or to be the subject of infringing activity (the "Infringing Material")
are the iN DEMAND Networks Works as described above. Specific violations of
copyrighted works by http://www.mininova.com/ are listed below this paragraph.

There are various additional locations of infringement on http://www.mininova.com/
website.  The above list is a specific sample of some of these, but all
infringements need to be addressed. 
 
  
 
Therefore, pursuant to the requirements of 17 U.S.C. § 512(c)(1)(C), iN DEMAND
Networks hereby demands that you remove or disable access to the Infringing Material
in an expeditious manner.   
 
  
 
If you have questions, please contact Net Enforcers' Compliance Management
Department via facsimile to 352-505-0040, or via email to
Compliance.Management@NetEnforcers.com.  All communication must be in writing.  Net
Enforcers is authorized to handle and resolve this matter with you and has already
been involved with this case.  Calls directly to iN DEMAND Networks will not be
accepted.  If Infringer does not respond to this demand as requested by 5:00 p.m. on
4/3/2007, we will assume that this demand has been rejected and will proceed
accordingly. 
 
  
 
Sincerely, 
 
VCLM Law 
 
 
 
Lance C. Venable 
 
Attorney at Law 
 
  
 
LCV/roc
